welcome.title: I'm Lukas Inschlag
welcome.text: You want to know more about me and my projects? Then you've come to the right place!

about.title: About me
about.text-1: I am currently working as a Business IT Specialist, where my focus is on the ERP area. At the same time, I am currently studying for a Master's degree in Business Informatics at the Vienna University of Technology.
about.text-2: I am also involved in the development of Android Apps, where the projects 'Simple Schedule' and 'Task Custos' were my main projects.
about.job-desc-1:
Project Management, Internal ERP Consulting, First- and Second-Level Support
proALPHA, Tisoware, BÃ¶hme & Weihs, Jira Service Desk
about.job-desc-2: First-level support in the ERP area, support for IT projects, testing of adaptations
about.job-desc-3: first-level support in the IT infrastructure area, small ERP projects

ed_line1: Master Business Informatics, Vienna University of Technology
ed_line2: Bachelor of Business Informatics, Vienna University of Technology
ed_line3: AHS Matura: 'Don Bosco Real-, Aufbau- und Aufbaurealgymnasiums' in Unterwaltersdorf, Lower Austria

project.desc1:
Task Custos was my final project as part of my Advanced Android Developer (Udacity) certification. The primary goal was to integrate different technologies, that are available for Android.
These were for example: Google Place API (Geofencing), Google AdMob, Room for data persistence and various material components.
project.desc2:
Simple Schedule started out as a project to improve my skills in JAVA at the beginning of my studies. Aside from that, I felt that there was quite no app that could properly help organizing my timeschedule for university.
By including a Google+ test community, the feature request became more and more. With this, the - at the beginning very simple project - grow quite complex quickly.
Due to increasing workload at my studies I had to stop actively developing this app, but I definitely learned quite alot during this time.
project.desc3:
For my bachelor thesis I researched the topic of mobile sales processes and how mobile apps can improve this process. Together with a colleague I then developed an Android app to test out the possibilities such an app can provide.
For the full details, I have included my thesis here for interested readers.

misc.desc1: In my spare time I also draw and create graphics with Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator. Here are some of my works.
